API Lifecycle

Just a Proof of Concept (Main Page)

Blueprint: Generate Collection From Web Application

A blueprint for beginning the API lifecycle by generating a collection from a web application.

Define

Define the API by capturing the traffic in browser. (Additional Elements)

  • Interceptor - Running traffic through Interceptor in Chrome to capture activity.
  • Traffic Collection - A collection generated by recording traffic.
  • Team Workspace - A team workspace for managing an API.
  • Team - The team working on an API.
  • Github Repository - A Github repository.
  • Github Repository - A Github repository.
  • Use Cases - The business use cases for an API.
  • Environments - Indvidual environments for each stage of an APIs evolution.
  • Prototype Collection - A collection prototype for an API.
  • Schema - A machine readable plan, outline, or model for all or part of an API.
  • Examples - Examples of API request, responses, and messages.

Document

Provide humans with documentation. (Additional Elements)

  • Reference Documentation - Documentation that describes the entire surface area of an API.
  • Onboarding Documentation - Documentation intended for onboarding new users to an API.
  • Workflow Documentation - Documentation for API workflows.
  • Examples - Examples of API request, responses, and messages.

Test

Ensure an API has proper testing. (Additional Elements)

  • Contract Testing - The contract test for an API.
  • Performance Testing - Performance testing for an API.
  • Security Testing - The security tests for an API.

Monitor

Monitoring all of the API tests. (Additional Elements)

  • Contract Monitor - A monitor for an APIs contract test.
  • Performance Monitor - A monitor for the performance testing.
  • Security Monitor - A monitor for the security tests.

Discover

Ensure an API is discoverable. (Additional Elements)

  • Private Network - A private network for publishing APIs.
  • Public Network - A public network for publishing APIs.
  • Search - A search for APIs.
